title: A Randomized Double-Blind, Active-Controlled  Study of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in Patients With Sickle Cell Disease
officialTitle: A Randomized Double-Blind, Active-Controlled  Study of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in Patients With Sickle Cell Disease
description: This is a randomized double-blind, active-controlled  study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of DMD-551 (exon-skipping antisense oligonucleotide) in patients with Sickle Cell Disease. The study will enroll approximately 431 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 23-62 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Sickle Cell Disease
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
